qas.question: After the coup, when were presidential elections held?
At that time, who ran claiming to be the legitimate president of the country?
Who did Vieira beat in a runoff election?
When was Vieira, a former president, deposed?

context: In <a0_0>June 2005<a0_0/>, presidential elections were held for the first time since the coup that deposed Ialá. <a1_0>Ialá<a1_0/> returned as the candidate for the PRS, claiming to be the legitimate president of the country, but the election was won by former president <a2_0>João Bernardo Vieira<a2_0/>, deposed in the <a4_0>1999<a4_0/> coup. Vieira beat <a3_0>Malam Bacai Sanhá<a3_0/> in a runoff election. Sanhá initially refused to concede, claiming that tampering and electoral fraud occurred in two constituencies including the capital, Bissau.
